turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: I hope you know what....

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Trust Leonardo....

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Da Vinci made the real directions in a secret script that I decoded. The way the machine is running now, the gold will produce too quickly, clog, and the machine will shut itself down.  Isn't it wonderful?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Yeah, but what would happen if that little mirror came out of the crystal.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Wha -- you don't want to know...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: I wanna know...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Holy sh-h--things are going to get very interesting, very fast. Da Vinci would be proud of you.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Have I ever told you the world is beautiful...  I'd really like to play Nintendo with you, or something...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Hudson, I'm afraid I'm sticking with God.  But you're a close second, tough guy.  What is that smile?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: I got my planet back.

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: Way to go, Anna.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: When the Mayflowers find out we have the Codex, they're going to want to make a deal...

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: And then we'll arrest those greedy pigs... Is that it?

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: It's the site of their new museum and we're taking it over.  Operation Deflower Mayflower is going full speed ahead.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Oh Lord.... the only reason I ask is that Hudson, uh, Mr. Hawk, Hawkins, had some "neat" things to say about Darwin, Minerva, and you. Basically that you're part of the same car pool.

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: Anna.  Anna.  Anna.  If that were true, Almond Joy would have handed you your heart right after you handed me the Codex. Now, get some sleep.  Kit Kat...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Cat got his tongue?

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: Actually he never told us what it was.

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: How many times do I have to say it?  I didn't put the hit on Little Eddie... Never had anything against that kooky chimp.  I actually found him, "endearing."

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Sure.  Face down.  Two endearing shots to the back of the head. That's your mark, man.  What did Little Eddie ever do to...

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: You're hitting Rutherford's Auction House.  Easy as my brother's wife.  Directions are in the bag.  Just open the seventh floor safe and take out the thingie...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Or you cut off my thingie. Directions even your brother would understand.

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: Hawk, you're a great thief.  Got set up, did some time, nothing to be ashamed of.  Don't give me a sonata about you always just really wanted to settle down, open a hardware Store and sell spatulas...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: If the Mario brothers weren't Jersey's third largest family, I'd say kiss my ass.  But considering your status, I'll say slurp my butt.

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: What's your favorite sport, Hawk?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Baseball, why?

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: Good job, not pretty, but good.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Ah, the mafia, the cops; do I know how to party or what?

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: Outbid by my own wench, quelle bummere.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: Poor baby..... Here, Bunny.

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: Hawkmeister, we got you clothes, great hotel, and a 250,000 lira per diem.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: That's two hundred dollars a day? So he can get a hooker and some tequila.  Veto, Darwin.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: We want Da Vinci's sketchbook, what do they call it, the Codex.

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: Listen Hawk, this might be hard to believe, but I'm a regular joe.  I just want to be happy and happiness comes from the achieving of goals. It's just when you make your first billion by the age of 19, it's hard to keep coming up with new ones.  But now finally I got my new goal.  World domination.  With your help...Bunny....quit that!

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: Bunny, ball-ball!  Bad bunny!

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: Haven't you ever seen, like David Niven?  You know tiptoe in, tiptoe out.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: Like a "cat", one could say.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: No, let me!

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: I don't care.

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: So, Captain Hawk, in one of your paws you got a gold bar worth about 8 thou.  In the autre, you got lead that won't get you gelato.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: Surely a master-thief like you can tell the difference.

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: Alchemy!  Is the business term of the 90's, my man!  Minerva read about it in an airline magazine about four years ago.  I dumped some lira into research... Shazam, we come across a diary by one of Da Vinci's apprentices detailing La Machine de Oro, the gold machine for those at home, and the rest is about to become history.  Money isn't everything, gold is.  Fuck blue chip stocks!  Fuck T-bills! Fuck Junk Bonds!  I got the real deal!  Money will always be paper but gold will always be gold!

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: Market crashes.  Bomb drops. Greenhouse effect affects.  We'll still be the richest, most powerful people in the world.  In 1992, Europe is coming together to become one business superpower.  It's one party we'd love to poop.

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: Well, that said, the last ingredient in the recipe is in, get this, you're gonna die, the Kremlin.

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: I look at you Soviet people and I feel... pity... superiority.  Most of your life, your government has told you that Capitalism turns people into robots who'd rather eat microwave sushi, naked in the back of a Cadillac than hear the laughter of children.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: We're here to say, your government was right.

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: So let's get busy.  Have some fun and make some deals.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: I knew it!  I told you it was a fake.

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: That New-York-Italian-Father- made-twenty-bucks-a-week-son- of-a-bitch.  What was our bet?  A million?

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: Million five, lover...

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: For those kind of wages, I could have built the factory in America! They're Vietnamese, can't we just give them more Bart Simpson shirts? I hear depressing news like this and I want to commit genocide!  Alfred, hold my calls.  So, Hawk! The Hawkster!  What do you think of the vehicle?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: You could host American Bandstand in here.  Why did you duck at the auction, asshole?

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: Because I didn't want to get hurt, taterhead.

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: So Hawkasaurus, I won't mince words...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Whatever.  You own Boardwalk, you own Park Place, you own the four railroads.  You think you're God. For all I know, you're probably right.  I just wanted to have a damn cappuccino, maybe play some Nintendo after I find out what it is.  Man, why didn't you just <u>buy</u> the horse?  What am I saying, you did buy it...

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: Oh... Let's see.  There are organizations that think we wanted the "Sforza" for reasons other than putting it in the Da Vinci museum we're building in Vinci. Hopefully, these organizations think our plan has been ruined with the explosion of our replica. If I seem vague, grand.  We want a low profile on this, that's why I got Kaplan and the Candy bars involved.  I helped George help the Mario Brothers and Gates help get you out....

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: If you're pausing for a "thank you," give it up.  So boss, you going to tell me what the crystal piece inside the pony means?

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: Way to go, Alfie!  How many people did you break that thing in front of.   Good help's hard to find.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: I guess that's a no.

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: Come to think of it there is a part of your body that you won't need for your next job...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Hey, guys, I've always wanted to sing like Franki Valli and the other seasons, but come on....

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: I'll torture you so slowly you'll think it's a career!  I'll kill your family, your friends, and the bitch you took to the Prom!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: You want an address on that last one?

turns.speaker: DARWIN
turns.text: What a pleasant surprise.  You're probably wondering...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: But you're going to tell us anyway...

turns.speaker: GATES
turns.text: Have a seat.  Good to see you, buddy ol' pal...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: The pleasure's all yours, Officer Gates.

turns.speaker: GATES
turns.text: Why do you show your parole officer such disrespect? Especially after I got you such a nice job.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: What job?

turns.speaker: GATES
turns.text: The auction house, asshole.  One night's work and you're free like no ex-con's ever been.  No checking in with a shrink, no community service teaching retards how to play air hockey. It's a great deal, I can't lie.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: The only thing you can't do is get sex for free.  I know I was in prison for like basically the 80's, but, call me daffy, aren't you supposed to <u>stop</u> me from committing crimes.  You know, Book-em-Dano, Call-for-backup, Give-a-Hoot-Don't-Pollute.

turns.speaker: GATES
turns.text: You wouldn't be out if it wasn't for me!  I did dog and pony for you!  You think they would have let you out after what you did, you told the board members they looked like the Three Stooges...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: How was I supposed to know they were women?  Besides one of them was bald and kept saying "Soitinly."

turns.speaker: GATES
turns.text: Remember that guy in the cell next to you who hung himself?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GATES
turns.text: Remember that shoe you lost...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Uh, yeah.  Cut to the chase.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: What else do you got under there ... I don't want to be rude, but this is all pretty lame.

turns.speaker: GATES
turns.text: That's the beauty.  It's bullshit, but I can make it stick because I'm a good guy parole officer and you re a bad guy who's about to find out that there's a thin line between ex-con and escape con.

turns.speaker: GATES
turns.text: Hudson Hawkins gets the chair of honor.  How about a Gates-arita?  I used real hot dogs.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Weren't you the bartender at Jonestown?

turns.speaker: GATES
turns.text: All this trouble for a horsey. I may not know art, but I know what I like.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: You certainly do.

turns.speaker: GATES
turns.text: So when's that Sebastian-Cabot- Buckingham-Palace-looking- Butlerhead getting here?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Guess I know who wears the penis in this family.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: For God's sake, chain this convict.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Anybody have a cigarette?  But seriously, do me a favor and Concorde me back to prison.  I don't care anymore.  I hope you have the receipts for the threads.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: You go back, you won't be alone. You'll have a diabetic barkeep cellmate.  You're still young enough to have fun shanking child molesters for a pack of smokes, but "Alex" will go in knowing that the next time he gets out it'll be to attend his own funeral. Depressing.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: You wouldn't risk the dime to call the police.  You have no proof.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: Get away from there, convict!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Just browsing.  Don't touch me....

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: Big girls don't cry-I-eye.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Two minutes, 35 seconds.  Damnit, I'm involved in this thing, so I just wanna know what this thing is. I wanna be treated as an adult.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: Cool, isn't it?  Weight, feel, mal1eability, they're all but identical.  On the periodic chart of elements, they're but one proton apart.  Great minds worked for centuries to turn worthless into priceless.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Alchemy.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Sure.  The Kremlin.  Makes sense. The Kremlin.  Why not?  Listen, this is all too Indiana Jones and the Lost City of King Tut for me, man.  Throw me in jail and go ahead, just try and throw Alex...

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: Jail, you asshole!  Our foot soldiers will blow your brains out!  Bunny, Ball-Ball!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Bunny, not you too?

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: You've got a dilemma, tiger.  I think I know what's going to help you solve it.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: I hate a man with a sense of humor.  While you corn dogs were comparing the lengths of your masculinity, we obtained the helicopter the new fashioned way: a thoroughly corrupt business deal.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: If you think you're getting past me...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: You killed a friend.  Why should I help you go for the gold?

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: It'll take a couple of years of steady production, but I'll flood the market with so much gold that gold itself, the foundation of all finance, will lose its meaning. Brokers, economists, and fellow entrepreneurs will drown in the saliva of their own nervous breakdowns.  Markets will crash- crash.  Financial Empires will crumble-crumble.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Except yours-yours.  The goal of world domination.  Well, if you put it that way, Minnie.  How can I resist?

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: You can't, convict!  You're just a shmoe!  Every shmoe has the fantasy the planet revolves around them.  It rains, car crash stops traffic, you say "How could this happen to me?"  It's a natural inclination.  But for I, this isn't a fantasy, it is <u>reality</u>! You are on my planet!  You walk around the corner for coffee, out of my sight, you do not fucking exist!  The lives of shmoes like you have meaning only in relation to the rich, to the powerful, to ME!

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: If you pull this off, I can't promise I won't kill you.  I mean, who we trying to kid?  But I will spare the Flying Nun here....

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: And to think I thought you were Evil Incarnate in pumps.

turns.speaker: MINERVA
turns.text: I killed some lovable working class Italian-diabetic, but you killed the most significant male figure of the decade and a kind, gentle lover.  So don't play with me.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: This is the worst night...

turns.speaker: SNICKERS
turns.text: When it rains, it pours.  Name's Snickers.  The plane leaves in 40.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: You know Kaplan, if you weren't the slimiest pinata of shit that ever lived, I'd feel sorry for you.

turns.speaker: SNICKERS
turns.text: Good news, bud, the Mayflowers have moved up the time-table. You're hitting the Vatican to-night.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Tonight?  You're whacked.  The timing's off, I'm underequipped Damnit, I have a date!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Don't be stupid...they...

turns.speaker: SNICKERS
turns.text: Bastard!  If you were a true American.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Just shut up and hit me!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Damnit, I hate this!  I'm a cat burglar!  Nobody said anything about this fight-to-the-death shit.

turns.speaker: SNICKERS
turns.text: Too bad.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Don't I know you...

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: You just might.  I'm the guy who tricked you into robbing a government installation and then had you sent to prison for it.  At the time, I was bald with a beard, no moustache, and I had a different nose, so if you don't recognize me, I won't be offended.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Bastard, you're going to need another nose!

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: But I'm not the type of guy to hold a grudge.

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: I used you as a diversion.  while you were getting captured upstairs, I was shredding documents in the basement.  Deep down, I guess I was just jealous.  You were one incredible thief...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: To what do I owe the dishonor of a reunion, you centrally intelligent scumsicle.

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: I Want to make things up to you. That's why I got you this gig, doll.  Hawk, my name's George Kaplan and to quote the late, great Karen Carpenter, "We've only just begun."

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Three minutes, twenty-three seconds.  If you think I'm doing another...

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: Hush.  My employer wants a meeting.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Employer?  The president?

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: No, somebody powerful.  Oh.  Look. what's that up there?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: I'm supposed to fall for that?

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: Shucks.  Guess not.

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: Hawk, Hawk, Hawk.  Enjoying Italy?  I always had a soft spot for Rome.  Did my first barehanded strangulation here.  Communist politician.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Why George, you big softie...

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: God, I miss communism.  The Red Threat.  People were scared, the Agency was respected, and I got laid every night.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Thanks for sharing.

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: We blow up space shuttles for breakfast.  You and your friend Alex would be a late afternoon Triscuit.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: If you do anything to my friend...

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: Yeah, right.  By the way, as long as I'm getting things off my chest, I'm the one who killed your little monkey.  Made it look like a Mafia hit.  Did it for fun. Ciao.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Can't you see the Mayflowers double-crossed you...

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: They may be scum, but if I get the Da Vinci model back, then we'll be roasting weenies on the beach.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: I don't think you'll appreciate their choice of weenie.

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: I can't believe this.  I'm in fucking Russia, or do I have to say, the fucking Soviet Union and I'm shooting a non-Bolshevick.  I never thought I'd say "I'm just in this job for the money."  Sad. Any last immature quips?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: No.  But why do you let Butterfinger keep those blood stains on his shirt?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Why does this have to be so hard...

turns.speaker: KAPLAN
turns.text: Tell me about it...

turns.speaker: AD MAN #1
turns.text: We'll call it the Flying Donut!

turns.speaker: AD MAN #2
turns.text: The Dancing Dingus!

turns.speaker: AD MAN #1
turns.text: The Jerky Circle!

turns.speaker: AD MAN #1
turns.text: Something short.

turns.speaker: AD MAN #2
turns.text: Sharp.

turns.speaker: AD MAN #1
turns.text: Snappy.

turns.speaker: AD MAN #2
turns.text: With a little jazz.

turns.speaker: AD MAN #1
turns.text: The Shazzammeter!

turns.speaker: AD MAN #2
turns.text: The Hipster!

turns.speaker: AD MAN #1
turns.text: The Daddy-Oh!

turns.speaker: AD MAN #2
turns.text: The Circle-o'-Gaiety!

turns.speaker: AD MAN #1
turns.text: The Hoopsucker!

turns.speaker: AD MAN #2
turns.text: The Hudswinger!

turns.speaker: AD MAN #1
turns.text: The Hoop-dee-doo!

turns.speaker: AD MAN #2
turns.text: The Hudsucker Hoop!

turns.speaker: ADDISON
turns.text: My God, why?! Why did he do it?! Things were going so well!

turns.speaker: MUSSBURGER
turns.text: What am I a headshrinker? Maybe the man was unhappy.

turns.speaker: ADDISON
turns.text: He didn't look unhappy!

turns.speaker: ADDISON
turns.text: Nobody told me! Nobody told me! You sold all of our stock?

turns.speaker: MUSSBURGER
turns.text: We dumped the whole load. Now quit showboating, Addison --

turns.speaker: ADDISON
turns.text: I had twenty thousand shares! I'd be a millionaire now!

turns.speaker: MUSSBURGER
turns.text: Sure, sure, we'd all be millionaires. There's no point in looking back. At the time, Stilson thought dumping our position would panic the market, further depress the stock -- then we'd buy it all back, and more of course, once it got cheap --

turns.speaker: ADDISON
turns.text: Cheap! Cheap! It's never been more valuable! And I'm ruined! Ruined!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Who are you? How did you know who I am?

turns.speaker: MOSES
turns.text: Ah guess ole Moses knows jes about ever'thing, leastways if it concerns Hudsuckuh.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: But -- who are you -- what d'you do here?

turns.speaker: MOSES
turns.text: Ah keeps the ol' circle turning -- this ol' clock needs plenty o' care. Time is money, Miss Archuh, and money -- it drives that ol' global economy and keeps big Daddy Earth a-spinnin' on 'roun'. Ya see, without that capital fo'mation --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. Say, you won't tell anyone about me, will you?

turns.speaker: MOSES
turns.text: I don't tell no one nothin' lessen they ask. Thatches ain't ole Moses' way.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: So if you know everything about Hudsucker, tell me why the Board decided to make Norville Barnes president.

turns.speaker: MOSES
turns.text: Well, that even surprised ole Moses at fust. I didn't think the Board was that smart.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: That smart?!

turns.speaker: MOSES
turns.text: But then I figured it out: they did it 'cause they figured young Norville for an imbecile. Like some othuh people ah know.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Why on earth would they want a nitwit to be president?

turns.speaker: MOSES
turns.text: 'Cause they's little pigglies! They's tryin' to inspire panic, make that stock git cheap so's they can snitch it all up fo' themselves! But Norville, he's got some tricks up his sleeve, he does...

turns.speaker: MOSES
turns.text: ...But I guess you don't really know him any better than that board does, do ya, Miss Archuh?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Well, maybe I --

turns.speaker: MOSES
turns.text: An' only some kind a knucklehead thinks she knows things 'bout things she, uh -- when she don't, uh -- How'd that go?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: It's hardly the same --

turns.speaker: MOSES
turns.text: Why you don't even know y'own self -- you ain't exactly the genuine article are you, Miss Archuh?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Well, in connection with my job, sometimes I have to go undercover as it were --

turns.speaker: MOSES
turns.text: I don't mean that! Why you pretendin' to be such a hard ol' sourpuss! Ain't never gonna make you happy! Never made Warin' happy.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I'm happy enough.

turns.speaker: MOSES
turns.text: Okay, Miss Archuh.  ...I got gears to see to.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I'm plenty happy!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: ...Hello?

turns.speaker: MOSES
turns.text: Them po' young folks. Looks like Norville's in fo' the same kind o' heartache ol' Warin' had. But then, she never axed me 'bout dat...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: And is this guy from chumpsville?! I pulled the old mother routine --

turns.speaker: SMITTY
turns.text: Adenoids?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Lumbago.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I'm telling you, Smitty, the board of Hudsucker is up to something --

turns.speaker: SMITTY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SMITTY
turns.text: About seven minutes.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Yeah, I was all wet about your idea man... Well, thanks for being so generous... It is human, and you are divine... No, he's no faker. He's the 100% real McCoy beware-of- imitations genuine article: the guy is a real moron --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I'm tellin' ya, this guy's just the patsy and I'm gonna find out what for. There's a real story, Smitty, some kind of plot, a setup, a cabal, a -- oh, and say, did I tell ya?!

turns.speaker: SMITTY
turns.text: He didn't offer you money.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: A sawbuck!

turns.speaker: SMITTY
turns.text: Ten dollars? Let's grab a highball!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: On Norville Barnes!

turns.speaker: SMITTY
turns.text: Ol' satchel-butt...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I know they're gonna buy that stock --

turns.speaker: SMITTY
turns.text: -- and she's dynamite!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: But, Al, it's the bunk! Norville showed me his design for the whatsit the day I met him! Why Buzz couldn't have invented it -- look at the man -- he's an imbecile!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Yeah, and I'll bet his initials are Sidney J. Mussburger!

turns.speaker: SMITTY
turns.text: You've lost it, Aim. You've gone soft by the looks of it -- soft on the dummy from Dubuque --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Muncie!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I'm sorry we had to take the stairs. It was just that horrible little elevator boy...

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Not at all. You're light as a feather.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: The couch, please.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Hungry, anyway.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I don't want to bore you with all the sordid details of my life; it's not a happy story...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: What a horrible little person.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Oh, Buzz is pretty harmless, really --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: At any rate I arrived in town not ten days ago, full of dreams and aspirations, anxious to make my way in the world --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: A little naive perhaps but -- thank you -- armed with determination, a solid work ethic, and an indomitable belief in the future --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: I myself --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Cigarette?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: No thank you. Seek and ye shall find, work and ye shall prosper -- these were the watch words of my education, the ethics of my tender years --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: -- these were the values that were instilled in me while I was growing up in a little town you've probably never heard of --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Mind if I join you?

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: You're from Muncie?!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Why yes, do you know it?

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: ...A Muncie girl! Talk about the cat's pyjamas! Tell you what, Amy. I'm gonna cancel the rest of my appointments this afternoon and get you a job here at the Hud.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Oh, no, really, I --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Don't bother to thank me, it's the easiest thing in the world. Matter of fact, I know where a vacancy just came up.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Oh, of all the foolish... Listen, do you take shorthand? Are you familiar with the mimeograph machine?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Of course -- I went to the Muncie, uh, Secretarial Polytechnic!

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: -- A Muncie girl! Can you beat that!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Well, I just don't know how to thank you, Mr. Barnes --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Please! Norville!

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: ...Did you happen to see the front page of today's Manhattan Argus?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Well, I... didn't bother to read the article. I didn't think the picture did you justice.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: The picture was fine! It's what that knuckle-headed dame wrote underneath! Of all the irresponsible... Amy, take this down: Dear Miss Archer. I call you 'Miss' because you seem to have 'missed' the boat completely on this one! How on earth would you know whether I'm an imbecile when you don't even have the guts to come in here and interview me man to man! No, change 'guts' to 'courage.' No, make it 'common decency.' These wild speculations about my intelligence --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: -- or lack thereof?

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: -- these preposterous inventions, would be better suited to the pages of Amazing Tales Magazine. If the editors of the Manhattan Argus see fit to publish the rantings of a disordered mind, perhaps they will see fit to publish this letter! But I doubt it. I most seriously doubt it. As I doubt also that you could find a home at Amazing Tales, a periodical which I have enjoyed for many years. Yours sincerely, et cetera.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Is that all, Mr. Barnes?

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: ...Well, you know me, Amy, at least better than that that dame does. Do you think I'm an imbecile?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I'm sure I --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Go on, tell the truth; I trust you and I put a lot of stock in your opinion.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Well, I --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Oh sure, you're biased -- you're a fellow Muncian. But would an imbecile come up with this?

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: ...You know! For kids!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: ...Why don't I just type this up...

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Aww, naw, Amy, that won't be necessary. I shouldn't send it; she's just doing her job, I guess.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Well, I don't know; maybe she does deserve it. Maybe she should've come in to face you man to man.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Well, she probably had a deadline...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Sure, but -- she could still have gotten your side for the record!

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Well, it's done now -- what's the use of grousing about it. Forget the letter, Amy, I just had to blow off some steam...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Confused?

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Yeah, you know, probably one of these fast-talking career gals, thinks she's one of the boys. Probably is one of the boys, if you know what I mean.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I'm quite sure I don't know what you mean.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Yeah, you know. Suffers from one of these complexes they have nowadays. Seems pretty obvious, doesn't it? She's probably very unattractive and bitter about it.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Oh, is that it!

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Yeah, you know. Probably dresses in men's clothing, swaps drinks with the guys at the local watering hole, and hobnobs with some smooth talking heel in the newsroom named Biff or Smoocher or...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Smitty.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Exactly. And I bet she's ugly. Real ugly. Otherwise, why wouldn't they print her picture next to her byline?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Maybe she puts her work ahead of her personal appearance.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: I bet that's exactly what she tells herself! But you and I both know she's just a dried-up bitter old maid. Say, how about you and I grab a little dinner and a show after work? I was thinking maybe The King and I --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: ...What happened?

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Oh. Nothing, really, just... the more timid investors are no longer running for cover.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Let me look.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Sid found me the icepack.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Let me hold it, or you'll have a real shiner.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Thanks. People seem to be pretty hot over this imbecile story.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: ...I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Oh, it isn't your fault, Amy. You're the one person who's been standing by me through all this.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Norville... there's something I have to tell you. You see, I'm not really a secretary.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: I know that, Amy.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: ...You do?

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: I understand that you're not very skilled yet in the secretarial arts. I'm not that skilled as president. Oh sure, I put up a big front --  -- not that everyone's buying it.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I believe in you, Norville -- At least I believe in your... intentions --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Oh, I don't blame them, really. I guess I have sort of made a mess of things. These folks have to protect their investment. Most of them are very nice people --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Norville, you can't trust people here like you did in Muncie...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: ...Certain people are --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Didja ever go to the top of old man Larson's feed tower and look out over the town?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: ...Huh?

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: You know, on farm route 17.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Oh yes! In Muncie!

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: No! In Vidalia! Farm Route 17!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Uh -- Yes. Seventeen. Yes, I -- well no, I -- I never really... There's a place I go now, the cutest little place near my apartment in Greenwich Village. It's called Ann's 440. It's a beatnik bar.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: You don't say.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Yes, you can get carrot juice or Italian coffee, and the people there -- well, none of them quite fit in. You'd love it -- why don't you come there with me -- they're having a marathon poetry reading on New Year's Eve. I go every year.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Every year?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Well -- this year -- if it's good I plan to make it a tradition. Uh, my it certainly is beautiful --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: ...The people look like ants.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Well, the Hindus say -- and the beatniks also -- that in the next life some of us will come back as ants. Some will be butterflies. Others will be elephants or creatures of the sea.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: What a beautiful thought.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: What do you think you were in your previous life, Amy?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Oh, I don't know. Maybe I was just a fast-talking career gal who thought she was one of the boys --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Oh no, Amy, pardon me for saying so but I find that very farfetched.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Norville, there really is something I have to tell you --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: That kind of person would come back as a wildebeest, or a warthog. No, I think it more likely that you were a gazelle, with long, graceful legs, gamboling through the underbrush. Perhaps we met once, a chance encounter in a forest glade. I must have been an antelope or an ibex. What times we must have had -- foraging together for sustenance, picking the grubs and burrs from one another's coats. Or perhaps we simply touched our horns briefly and went our separate ways...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I wish it were that simple, Norville. I wish I was still a gazelle, and you were an antelope or an ibex.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Well, can I at least call you deer? Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha! Seriously, Amy, the whole thing is what your beatnik friends call 'karma' -- the great circle of life, death and rebirth.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Yeah, I think I've heard of that. What goes around comes around.

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: That's it. A great wheel that gives us each what we deserve...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Oh, Norville --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Kiss me once, Amy! Kiss me once for luck!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Sure, Norville, sure...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: For Pete's sake, Norville!

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Oh! Hello, Amy -- was it -- I thought she said, Mamie --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Never mind about that...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: ...You know what those nincompoops in the boardroom are doing?

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Well, I wouldn't call them nincom --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: They're going to discharge eight percent of the work force here at Hudsucker. Why, in New York alone that means eighteen hundred people out of work, people with wives and children and families --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Well yes, we're pruning away some of the dead wood, but if --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You mean you know about this?

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Know about it? You think the Board would do anything like this without my authorization? No, this was my idea from the start.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Your i --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: We have to be realistic, Amy. You know things have slowed down a little here at Hudsucker --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You're awful kind to yourself, Norville Barnes -- the fact is you've slowed down, sitting up here like a sultan, not doing a lick of work! Why you know it's ideas that are the lifeblood of industry and you haven't come up with one since the hoop and the reason's plain to see! You've forgotten what made your ideas exciting for you in the first place -- it wasn't for the fame and the wealth and the mindless adulation of -- would you get out of here?!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: ...I've been watching you, Norville Barnes, even though you've been trying to avoid me --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Now, Aim --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Shutup! -- and don't think I haven't noticed how you've changed. I used to think you were a swell guy -- well, to be honest I thought you were an imbecile --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Now, Aim --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Shutup! -- but then I figured out you were a swell guy, a little slow maybe, but a swell guy! Well, maybe you're not so slow, but you're not so swell either and it looks like you're an imbecile after --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Now, Aim --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Shutup! -- after all! You haven't talked to me for a week and now I'm going to say my piece. I've got a prediction for you, Norville Barnes: I predict that since you've decided to dedicate yourself to greed and sloth and everything bad, you're going to lose all the good things that your good ideas brought you. You're going to throw them all away chasing after money and ease and the respect of a Board that wouldn't give you the time of day if you... if you...

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Worked in a watch factory?

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Now, Amy --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Consider this my resignation --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: ...You son of a --

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Norville!

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Huh?!

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: ...Oh, it's you! Lookin' for a nitwit to buy your lunch?!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Oh Norville, I --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Barman! Set'm up, fella!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Norville, I'm sorry, I... I tried to tell you... so many times... It's hard to admit when you've been wrong. If you could just... find it in your heart to -- to give me another chance --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Hey! Where's that martini?!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Just give me another chance, Norville -- I can help you fight this thing. I know this last story was a lie! We can prove it! We can --

turns.speaker: NORVILLE
turns.text: Aww, what's the difference. I'm all washed up... When you're dead, ya stay dead... Hey, fella!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Well that just about does it! I've seen Norville Barnes, the young man in a big hurry, and I've seen Norville Barnes the self-important heel, but I've never seen Norville Barnes the quitter, and I don't like it!
